definition: kun 鯤|鲲[kun1] and peng 鵬|鹏[Peng2], mythological beasts/peng, a gigantic bird transformed from the kun
fry (newly hatched fish)/legendary giant fish that could transform into a giant bird 鵬|鹏[Peng2]
lit. the giant Peng bird spreads its wings and begins to fly/displaying awesome power and momentum at the outset/to have the world at one's feet

sentences.english: After Yang Kunpeng absents , can the rear guard line need to transform greatly.
sentences.chinese: 楊鯤鵬缺席後，中能後防線需要大改造。

sentences.english: The report said the carrier was unprofitable.
sentences.chinese: 報道說，鯤鵬航空沒有實現盈利。

sentences.english: Sometimes dream soaring above the earth like a roc.
sentences.chinese: 有時候，夢想像鯤鵬一樣，展翅高飛。

definition: outstanding people/water and fire (in Daoist writing)
southern states of Wu and Chu/the middle and lower Yangtze valley
variant of 御[yu4]/to drive/to manage/to control
luan and phoenix/husband and wife/virtuous person/sovereign/belle
fire beacon (used as alarm signal over long distance)
center or bull's eye of an archery target (old)/goal/target
watchtower on either side of a city gate/(literary) city/imperial palace
